comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,25 @@
+## Purpose
+
+This directory contains a Dockerfile that builds Envoy with the [OQS BoringSSL master-with-bazel branch](https://github.com/Post-Quantum-Mesh/boringssl) modified to build the liboqs library and use the most updated BoringSSL source code.
+
+## Pre-Built Docker Image
+
+A pre-built [Docker image](https://hub.docker.com/layers/drouhana/envoy-oqs/envoy/images/sha256-e779ccfd8707e31fbf3f47f1f2ac99cb52ea56f6e923a87fbb12b7fa1dbca114?context=repo) has been provided for streamlined use in envoy implementations.
+
+## Local Docker Build
+
+Install [Docker](https://docs.docker.com/get-docker/) and run the following commands:
+
+    docker build -t envoy-oqs .
+
+## Using the Image
comment.body:
> images can be used identically to the standard envoy images

Can you please add a link to such documentation? dockerhub doesn't contain info at https://hub.docker.com/r/envoyproxy/envoy

Daniel

comment.body:
README.md now states:

> An example implementation of oqs-enabled envoy terminating a tls handshake and proxying to an http backend has been included

Where has this been included? Link(s) would be helpful to understand this statement.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -426,6 +463,50 @@ jobs:
                   docker tag oqs-openssh-img $TARGETNAME/openssh:latest &&
                   docker push $TARGETNAME/openssh:latest
 
+  ubuntu_x64_envoy:
+    description: Building and pushing OQS-enabled envoy
+    docker:
+      - image: openquantumsafe/envoy:latest
+        auth:
+          username: $DOCKER_LOGIN
+          password: $DOCKER_PASSWORD
+    steps:
+      - checkout # change this from "checkout" to "*localCheckout" when running CircleCI locally
+      - setup_remote_docker
+      - run:
+          name: Authenticate to Docker
+          command: echo $DOCKER_PASSWORD | docker login --username $DOCKER_LOGIN --password-stdin
+      - run:
+          name: Build OQS envoy
+          command: |
+            docker build -t envoy-oqs . 
+          working_directory: envoy
+      - run:
+          name: Build curl with liboqs
+          command: |
+            docker build -t oqs-curl . 
+          working_directory: curl
+      - run:
+          name: Test OQS envoy TLS servers using built OQS envoy
+          command: |
+            ./certs/gen_cert.sh &&
comment.body: This doesn't look right if working directory is set to `envoy/certs`

comment.body: Is this build "overkill"? Would it be sufficient to simply run `openquantumsafe/curl` and not re-build it? This would safe considerable build time.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -426,6 +463,50 @@ jobs:
                   docker tag oqs-openssh-img $TARGETNAME/openssh:latest &&
                   docker push $TARGETNAME/openssh:latest
 
+  ubuntu_x64_envoy:
+    description: Building and pushing OQS-enabled envoy
+    docker:
+      - image: openquantumsafe/envoy:latest
+        auth:
+          username: $DOCKER_LOGIN
+          password: $DOCKER_PASSWORD
+    steps:
+      - checkout # change this from "checkout" to "*localCheckout" when running CircleCI locally
+      - setup_remote_docker
+      - run:
+          name: Authenticate to Docker
+          command: echo $DOCKER_PASSWORD | docker login --username $DOCKER_LOGIN --password-stdin
+      - run:
+          name: Build OQS envoy
+          command: |
+            docker build -t envoy-oqs . 
+          working_directory: envoy
+      - run:
+          name: Build curl with liboqs
+          command: |
+            docker build -t oqs-curl . 
+          working_directory: curl
+      - run:
+          name: Test OQS envoy TLS servers using built OQS envoy
+          command: |
+            ./certs/gen_cert.sh &&
+            docker-compose pull &&
comment.body: `docker-compose` is most likely not available in CircleCI: See documentation [here](https://circleci.com/docs/docker-compose).
